thread.title: Cristiano Ronaldo's Ballon d'Or raises 600,000 at charity auction
thread.title_full: Cristiano Ronaldo's Ballon d'Or raises 600,000 at charity auction

posts.title: Cristiano Ronaldo's Ballon d'Or raises 600,000 at charity auction
posts.text:
Real Madrid Money to go to children's charity Make-A-Wish Cristiano Ronaldo's Ballon d'Or raises 600,000 at charity auction Facebook Cristiano Ronaldo analyses his past, present and future 
C ristiano Ronaldo's Ballon d'Or raised 600,000 euros at a recent auction to raise money for the Make-A-Wish charity that gives seriously ill children the chance to realise their dreams and focus on something positive. 
Idan Ofer, Israel's richest person, paid 600,000 for the single replica of the Ballon d'Or trophy, an item that Ronaldo himself had donated. 
This figure will go straight to the foundation and help them make even more memories for children battling illness. 
Usually when a player wins the prestigious award, they ask for the replica to be given to the club, or they prefer to keep it in a trophy cabinet. 
Ronaldo specifically asked for the replica of his 2013 award, to be donated to the charity auction. 
Pep Guardiola and Jose Mourinho too contributed to the event with 30,000 euros being paid to watch a boxing match in Manchester, this included a meet and greet with the two coaches. 
The Make-A-Wish Foundation auction is the most exclusive charitable events in London. There is an online art auction where fortunes are paid for sculptures and paintings and it is all in aid of an organisation that has helped children for over 35 years. Cargando siguiente contenido

posts.title: Theo, Benzema and Marcelo return to Real Madrid training | MARCA in English
posts.text:
Real Madrid They'd all been out with injury Theo, Benzema and Marcelo return to Real Madrid training Facebook Cristiano Ronaldo trained alone with Portugal 
I t may be the international break, but Real Madrid trained on Wednesday afternoon, with the non-internationals and the Castilla B-teamers taking part, as well as Theo Hernandez, Karim Benzema and Marcelo. 
The trio have been missing from action in recent weeks, but were back on the training pitch for this one. 
Marcelo, though, could only complete the first half of the workout, while the two Frenchmen were able to stay for the whole session. 
The only other players that Zinedine Zidane still has on his medical report are Dani Carvajal, Mateo Kovacic and Gareth Bale . Related tags

thread.title: Achraf Hakimi's secrets
thread.title_full: Achraf Hakimi's secrets

posts.author: Laura Rubioadapted Euan Mctear
posts.title: Achraf Hakimi's secrets
posts.text: Real Madrid - His brother and friend reveal all Achraf Hakimi's secrets Adapted by Euan McTear 05/10/2017 10:15 He has now made his debut, filling in for Dani Carvajal against Espanyol last Sunday, but Achraf Hakimi still remains something of a mystery to many Real Madrid supporters. Publicidad However, thanks to his brother Nabil and friend Alvaro, some of the 18-year-old right-back's secrets have been revealed. His first steps Arra - as the players asks to be called, to avoid confusion over his name - began his footballing career at Club Deportivo Colonia, at just six years of age. "He always loved football and watched a lot of videos," his lifelong friend Alvaro recalls. "It seemed like football was the only thing that existed for him." Making it to Valdebebas It wasn't long before Real Madrid spotted him and brought him into their youth academy. "A scout approached my father and told him that he wanted him to come for trials at Real Madrid," his brother remembers."They took him to a tournament in Palencia and it was there that they decided which kids would stay, with him being one of them." A FIFA ban In 2009 he became part of Los Blancos' Benjamin B youth team, passing through all of the levels to quickly make the Castilla team. Yet that was when he experienced one of his worst years as a footballer, as he was one of the youngsters sanctioned by FIFA. "He didn't expect it and didn't understand what had happened, Nabil explains"They had a game near Bilbao and once there they told him he couldn't play." His relationship with Zidane One of the most difficult decisions Achraf has had to make was this summer, when he had a number of offers from other European clubs. However, he decided to stay and fight for minutes at the Estadio Santiago Bernabeu, all because of Zinedine Zidane."He has always been close to Zidane, both to him and to his sons," those who know him best explain. A Moroccan idol He may still be a teenager, but already he is an idol in Moroccan. "He is better known there and they consider him as an idol," Alvaro points out. Publicidad He struck a penalty without boots Nabil and Alvaro will never forget one match that Achraf played with a Madrid XI. "He told us that he had something prepared, but we never imagined that what he was referring to was that he was going to strike a penalty with no boots on," they reveal, laughing. "He saw it in a video and kicked his boot first to distract the goalkeeper and then hit the ball."The goal didn't count as they disallowed the penalty he hit, but they won in the end." Outbrain

posts.title: A television company ran a promotion guaranteeing anyone who bought a 50 inch 4K television a full refund if Argentina do not qualify for the World Cup.
posts.text:
World Cup Qualifiers August promotion could backfire Argentina World Cup failure would force retailer to refund hundreds of TV sets Facebook Who is the MLS underdog who stopped La Albiceleste 
I n August, television company Noblex ran a promotion guaranteeing anyone who bought a 50 inch 4K television between August 24 and August 31 a full refund if Argentina do not qualify for the World Cup. 
Before the game against Uruguay at the end of the sales period, all 300 televisions available in the promotion had been sold. Now, the company is preparing to provide refunds. 
It will be a tough task for Argentina to qualify for the World Cup after drawing with Peru on Thursday nigh t, and they must now beat Ecuador to guarantee their spot in Russia. 
"Seven thousand people have gone on to our website to buy televisions after the draw with Peru," said Luis Galli, president of the Newsan-Noblex Group on Radio La Red. Related tags

thread.title: CAS confirms decision to strip Chicherova of 2008 high jump medal | MARCA in English
thread.title_full: CAS confirms decision to strip Chicherova of 2008 high jump medal | MARCA in English

posts.title: CAS confirms decision to strip Chicherova of 2008 high jump medal | MARCA in English
posts.text:
Athletics Russian has lost her appeal CAS confirms decision to strip Chicherova of 2008 high jump medal Reuters 
R ussian high jumper Anna Chicherova has lost her appeal against the decision to strip her of her 2008 Beijing Olympics bronze medal over a doping offence, sport's highest tribunal CAS said on Friday. 
Chicherova was disqualified by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) in October last year after she tested positive for the banned substance dehydrochlormethyltestosterone (turinabol) in re-testing of samples from the Games. 
"The IOC Disciplinary Decision in which the athlete was found to have committed an anti-doping rule violation at the 2008 Beijing Olympic Games is confirmed," CAS said in a statement. 
"The athlete is disqualified from the women's high jump event in which she placed third." 
Chicherova, who is among several athletes to have been stripped of their Olympic medals following re-tests of samples from the 2008 and 2012 Games, told Reuters by text message that she was not ready to comment. 
"It seems that the arguments raised in the court by our side were pretty strong," she said. "We now need to analyse the full report on the hearings, which is 94 pages long, in order to make further decisions." 
Chicherova went on to win gold at London Olympics four years later. She said in June last year that a re-test from that event had been negative. 
Russia's athletics federation is suspended over a 2015 World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) report that exposed systematic state-sponsored doping in Russian athletics. 
While Russia has pledged to co-operate with global sports bodies over its anti-doping programme, it has never acknowledged state support for doping.

thread.title: Two own goals help World Cup hosts Russia beat South Korea | MARCA in English
thread.title_full: Two own goals help World Cup hosts Russia beat South Korea | MARCA in English

posts.title: Two own goals help World Cup hosts Russia beat South Korea | MARCA in English
posts.text:
Russia 2018 World Cup Kim Ju-young helped to a 4-2 win over in a friendly international Two own goals help World Cup hosts Russia beat South Korea Reuters Ukraine revive hopes with rain-soaked win over Kosovo 
T wo own goals in three second-half minutes from defender Kim Ju-young helped Russia to a 4-2 win over South Korea in a friendly international in Moscow on Saturday. 
The hosts of next year's World Cup were relieved to enjoy a confidence-boosting win in their first international test since they were knocked out of the Confederations Cup on home soil at the group stage in June. 
Russia had some bright moments but were grateful for lucky breaks in the second half against a team that finished second in their Asian qualifying group. 
After Fedor Smolov had headed home a corner from Alexander Samedov just before halftime, Russia forged further ahead after the break when wayward touches by Kim saw him inadvertently beat his own goalkeeper Kim Seung-gyu twice in quick succession. 
Lokomotiv Moscow midfielder Alexei Miranchuk added another for Russia in the 83rd minute. 
Kwon Kyung-won headed past Russian goalkeeper Igor Akinfeev in the 87th minute before Ji Dong-won earned further consolation for the visitors in the dying seconds. 
"We've taken a step in the right direction," Russian coach Stanislav Cherchesov told reporters. 
"I liked the score. I liked that we played more consistently." 
As World Cup hosts, Russia have not had the opportunity to gauge their strength against Europe's best in qualifying and have been trying to compensate for the lack of genuine competition by playing friendlies. 
The return of Zenit St. Petersburg striker Alexander Kokorin brought energy to Russia's usually blunt attack after nearly a year's absence from the national team. 
Yet the 26-year-old, long snubbed for his poor form and involvement in off-pitch controversy, missed several scoring chances in the first half and lacked coordination with fellow striker Smolov. 
"Smolov and Kokorin tried hard, they tried to help the defence," Cherchesov said. 
"Any player needs time. They tried to find each other, to play with each other but they sometimes overplayed the ball." 
Russia play another friendly against Iran in Kazan on Oct. 10 Related tags

thread.title: Aubameyang blames 'cursed orange juice' for Gabon's World Cup qualification failure
thread.title_full: Aubameyang blames 'cursed orange juice' for Gabon's World Cup qualification failure

posts.title: Aubameyang blames 'cursed orange juice' for Gabon's World Cup qualification failure
posts.text:
World Cup Qualifiers Star striker said the team were ill Aubameyang blames 'cursed orange juice' for Gabon's World Cup qualification failure Facebook En Español 
G abon will yet again miss out on appearing at the FIFA World Cup in 2018 after falling to a 3-0 defeat against Morocco and forward Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang has suggested that the side might have been given some orange juice that had been tampered with. 
The Borussia Dortmund striker tweeted that his side lost because half of the team were suffering with stomach pains, which he blamed on orange juice. 
"Half of the team and the staff unbelievable stomach ache on the day of the match [sic]," he tweeted. "What cursed orange juice." 
Aubameyang's international teammate and Lorient player, Denis Bouanga, later replied to the tweet saying that the consumption of the juice was when things started to go wrong. 
Afterwards, Morocco's Mehdi Benatia responded through a video on his own Instagram, telling his 'old friend' that there was nothing wrong with the juice. El Capitano @MedhiBenatia a un petit message pour @Aubameyang7 concernant le jus dorange pic.twitter.com/ifGEOE5qMx

thread.title: Serie A: El Napoli se interesa en Onana, exportero de La Masia | Marca.com
thread.title_full: Serie A: El Napoli se interesa en Onana, exportero de La Masia | Marca.com

posts.author: Michael Koorenreuters
posts.title: Serie A: El Napoli se interesa en Onana, exportero de La Masia | Marca.com
posts.text:
Serie A El camerunés de 21 años actualmente milita en el Ajax El Napoli se interesa en Onana, exportero de La Masia Twitter Enviar 09/10/2017 12:40 CEST André Onana (21) festeja un gol en un partido entre el Ajax y el Legia de Varsovia Michael Kooren Reuters 0 
Todo parece indicar que el equipo napolitano está en busca de un sucesor para Pepe Reina. De acuerdo con el Corriere dello Sport , el equipo de Aurelio De Laurentiis estaría en conversaciones con André Onana, meta al servicio del Ajax holandés que tuvo sus inicios en La Masia. 
El camerunés de 21 años cumpliría los requisitos del entrenador Maurizio Sarri, quien busca un portero joven aunque con cierta experiencia. Cabe anotar que el titular en el arco napolitano, el madrileño Pepe Reina, culmina su contrato en verano de 2018 al igual que su sustituto, el brasileño Rafael. 
Onana aterrizó en la capital holandesa en 2015, procedente del juvenil A del Barcelona. En la presente temporada, completa 990 minutos repartidos entre liga y competición europea.

thread.title: Ballon d'Or: The list of the 30 nominees: Cristiano Ronaldo and Messi lead the way | MARCA in English
thread.title_full: Ballon d'Or: The list of the 30 nominees: Cristiano Ronaldo and Messi lead the way | MARCA in English

posts.title: Ballon d'Or: The list of the 30 nominees: Cristiano Ronaldo and Messi lead the way | MARCA in English
posts.text:
En Español 
7:15 pm: No more waiting. The last five nominees for the Ballon d'Or are Cristiano Ronaldo, Eden Hazard, Isco, Bonucci and Kylian Mbappe. With these names, the list of the 30 players who will compete for the award in this edition is complete. 
6:35 pm: Another five nominees. They are Messi, Aubameyang, Cavani, Hummels and Benzema. There are already 25 players known, only five other names remain to be revealed, and they will be made public at 7:15 pm. 
5:50 pm: Time for five more nominees. The fourth Real Madrid player on the list is Toni Kroos and he is joined by Radamel Falcao, Sadio Mane, Gigi Buffon and Antoine Griezmann. Atletico's French striker is the second Rojiblanco to be nominated after Jan Oblak. 
2:pm: David de Gea is in the next list of five that has been revealed along with De Bruyne, Lewandowski, Harry Kane and Dzeko. We are now half way through the nominees with Messi and Ronaldo still to be named. 
12:pm: Here are the next five nominees with three Sergio Ramos, Luis Suarez and Oblak all playing their football in Spain. Phillippe Countinho of Liverpool and Napoli striker Dries Mertens is also on the list. 
9:am: Real Madrid pair Marcelo and Luka Modric along with Paris Saint-Germain's Neymar are among the first five nominees for the Ballon D'Or, announced by France Football. 
Juventus' Paulo Dybala and N'Golo Kante of Chelsea are also on the list that the French publication released on Twitter. The first 5 nominees for the 2017 Ballon dOr France Football : Neymar, Luka Modri, Paulo Dybala, Marcelo, N'Golo Kanté #ballondor pic.twitter.com/QnyakD9bhw 
? France Football (@francefootball) 9 octobre 2017 
During the day, France Football will give the full 30 candidates and the winner will be chosen by the votes of selected international journalists while national team captains and coaches no longer have a say since FIFA stopped taking part in 2010. 
Ronaldo is the big favourite to win the award for a fifth time having been chosen in 2008, 2013, 2014 and 2016, and in so doing would match the total of Messi who was picked in 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012 and 2015. Cargando siguiente contenido

thread.title: ¿Te gustaría que tu seguro de coche te recompensara por ser un buen conductor?
thread.title_full: ¿Te gustaría que tu seguro de coche te recompensara por ser un buen conductor?

posts.author: Daniel G. Lifona
posts.title: ¿Te gustaría que tu seguro de coche te recompensara por ser un buen conductor?
posts.text:
Modelos de coches Drive&Win, el seguro que monitoriza tu forma de conducir, cumple cuatro meses ¿Te gustaría que tu seguro de coche te recompensara por ser un buen conductor? 0 Comentar Drive&Win promete revolucionar el mercado de menores de 25 años 
" ¿Por qué a mí? Si soy un buen conductor". A diferencia de la fórmula clásica de penalizar a los conductores de forma casi indiscriminada y subir anualmente la prima de riesgo del seguro, Drive&Win propone justamente lo contrario: reforzar de forma positiva el buen uso del coche mediante premios y recompensas . 
La idea, surgida hace años en Reino Unido, fue traída a España por Drive&Win, el seguro digital que quiere revolucionar el mercado con una forma completamente nueva de asegurar automóviles creando una comunidad de buenos conductores que pretende mejorar la seguridad vial reduciendo los accidentes de tráfico. 
La compañía con sede en la localidad madrileña de Las Rozas cumple ahora cuatro meses y anuncia que ha llegado a un acuerdo con una importante aseguradora para atender a los conductores de menos de 25 años o con poco tiempo de carnet, que son los que encuentran más dificultades a la hora de contratar una póliza sin precios abusivos. 
"Hasta ahora estábamos limitados al perfil de conductores que las compañías de seguros que nos proporcionan cobertura consideran de bajo riesgo. Las estadísticas les dicen, por ejemplo, que las personas de menos de 25 años son un gran riesgo para asegurar. Por eso, el precio del seguro para esos colectivos es mucho más alto que para el resto y la oferta es mucho menor. Pero ahora hemos llegado a un acuerdo con una compañía de primer nivel para poner en práctica nuestra idea de Drive&Win con los conductores que más lo necesitan", explica Luis Peña , director general de Drive&Win. 
La idea es que los conductores jóvenes o noveles puedan demostrar su buen uso del coche para reducir la prima de riesgo de su seguro. La tarifa se ajustará a la forma de conducir de cada cliente , lo que evitará, por primera vez, que se discrimine a los conductores por su edad. 
El funcionamiento se basa en una aplicación móvil (app) que monitoriza y valora el comportamiento del conductor basándose en parámetros de velocidad, aceleración, frenada, cambios bruscos de dirección y patrones de uso . 
El ex piloto de Fórmula 1 Roberto Merhi puso a prueba el martes su forma de conducir y circular durante un trayecto de 80 kilómetros (ida y vuelta) entre Madrid y el embalse de Los Arroyos, situado en el municipio de El Escorial. El castellonense se puso a los mandos de un Lexus GS300 y dio una clase magistral de buena conducción al ganador del reto Drive&Win, el joven madrileño Albert David . 
Gracias a la información que recoge la aplicación, Drive&Win puede ofrecer mejores tarifas y condiciones a los buenos conductores , porque en lugar de basarse en estadísticas y parámetros generales como otras aseguradoras, se basa en hechos. Ya no importa la edad o los años de carnet, sólo que conduzcas bien. 
Una vez que la app está activada, transmite los datos sobre la conducción cada vez que se hace un trayecto. Cuando ésta detecta que se inicia un desplazamiento comienza a registrar los datos y se apaga al llegar a destino. El conductor siempre puede acceder a ella para consultar su nota de conducción, sus trayectos o datos de la póliza . 
Además, cada semana los buenos conductores reciben recompensas que premian sus buenos hábitos al volante: vales de gasolina, cheques de lavado de coche, entradas de cine, o cheques regalo para realizar compras en Amazon . Y si lo prefieren, pueden utilizar sus recompensas para apoyar a causas solidarias. 
"Nuestro sistema nos permite diferenciar a los buenos conductores de los que no lo son, y gracias a eso, en muy poco tiempo podemos ofrecer un seguro a cualquier persona que conduzca bien , independientemente de su edad, experiencia o historial de seguro", añade Luis Peña. TE PUEDE INTERESAR

posts.text:
Real Madrid Returned early from Costa Rica duty Muscle injury makes Keylor Navas a doubt for Tottenham clash Facebook Twitter 
n injury suffered while on international duty with Costa Rica is set to rule Keylor Navas out of this weekend's trip to face Getafe, while he is also now a doubt for Real Madrid's Champions League match against Tottenham. 
It was expected that he would be rested for the LaLiga trip to Getafe in any case, but a swollen adductor muscle in his right groin means he has now been added to the medical report, along with Gareth Bale, Dani Carvajal and Mateo Kovacic. 
Real Madrid confirmed the issue on Wednesday evening, reporting that the player had undergone tests at the Sanitas La Moraleja University Hospital.

thread.title: Delevigne, víctima del acoso sexual de Harvey Weinstein
thread.title_full: Delevigne, víctima del acoso sexual de Harvey Weinstein

posts.author: marca.com
posts.title: Delevigne, víctima del acoso sexual de Harvey Weinstein
posts.text:
Cine y TV Cine y TV La lista de mujeres acosadas por el productor, aumenta Acusan al productor Harvey Weinstein de abusar sexualmente de ocho mujeres Angelina Jolie y Gwyneth Paltrow denuncian acosos sexuales de Harvey Weinstein 
Cara Delevigne admitió que fue una de las muchas víctimas del acoso sexual al que el productor norteamericano Harvey Weinstein sometió durante años a varias actrices de Hollywood. 
En un mensaje colgado en su cuenta personal de Instagram, la maniquí e intérprete inglesa, de 25 años, contó cómo Weinstein la citó en una habitación de hotel, donde pretendía realizar un trío sexual junto con otra mujer. 
Cuando Delevigne se negó , el productor, que previamente había fanfarroneado sobre otros encuentros sexuales que había mantenido con otras actrices, cuyas carreras supuestamente había impulsado, se abalanzó sobre ella, aunque ésta logró zafarse. 
" En cuanto nos quedamos solos, empezó a presumir de todas las actrices con las que se había acostado y de cómo había impulsado sus carreras , y habló de temas de naturaleza sexual inapropiados y entonces me invitó a subir a su habitación", dijo la modelo. 
Si bien ella declinó esa invitación en un principio, alegando que tenía que esperar a un taxi, el ayudante del productor la persuadió para que le acompañara , lo que le hizo sentir "muy desamparada y asustada". 
"Cuando llegué me sentí aliviada al encontrar a otra mujer en la habitación , lo que me hizo sentir que estaba a salvo, pero entonces nos pidió que nos besáramos y ella empezó a avanzar en su dirección" , relató. When I first started to work as an actress, i was working on a film and I received a call from Harvey Weinstein asking if I had slept with any of the women I was seen out with in the media. It was a very odd and uncomfortable call....i answered none of his questions and hurried off the phone but before I hung up, he said to me that If I was gay or decided to be with a woman especially in public that Id never get the role of a straight woman or make it as an actress in Hollywood. A year or two later, I went to a meeting with him in the lobby of a hotel with a director about an upcoming film. The director left the meeting and Harvey asked me to stay and chat with him. As soon as we were alone he began to brag about all the actresses he had slept with and how he had made their careers and spoke about other inappropriate things of a sexual nature. He then invited me to his room. I quickly declined and asked his assistant if my car was outside. She said it wasnt and wouldnt be for a bit and I should go to his room. At that moment I felt very powerless and scared but didnt want to act that way hoping that I was wrong about the situation. When I arrived I was relieved to find another woman in his room and thought immediately I was safe. He asked us to kiss and she began some sort of advances upon his direction. I swiftly got up and asked him if he knew that I could sing. And I began to sing....i thought it would make the situation better....more professional....like an audition....i was so nervous. After singing I said again that I had to leave. He walked me to the door and stood in front of it and tried to kiss me on the lips. I stopped him and managed to get out of the room. I still got the part for the film and always thought that he gave it to me because of what happened. Since then I felt awful that I did the movie. I felt like I didnt deserve the part. I was so hesitant about speaking out....I didnt want to hurt his family. I felt guilty as if I did something wrong. I was also terrified that this sort of thing had happened to so many women I know but no one had said anything because of fear. Una publicación compartida de Cara Delevingne (@caradelevingne) el 11 de Oct de 2017 a la(s) 10:39 PDT 
En su mensaje de Instagram, Delevigne, que afirma que fue "reacia" a denunciar la situación porque se sentía "culpable" y por "no herir a la familia" de Weinstein (casado con la diseñadora británica Georgina Chapman, con la que tiene dos hijos pequeños), urge a las mujeres a "no avergonzarse" a la hora de contar sus historias pues ello "inspirará a otras".

posts.author: Xavi Hern Ndezbarcelonaadapted Euan Mctear
posts.title: Barcelona are preparing their Christmas wish list | MARCA in English
posts.text:
Barcelona They have plenty of unfinished business 
W hile new arrivals Nelson Semedo and Paulinho have been performing well so far this season, Barcelona still have plenty of work to do to try to solve the outstanding issues of what was a very tough summer . 
In losing Neymar and failing to land Marco Verratti or Philippe Coutinho, many members of the Blaugrana fanbase were disappointed by the summer business, even if there wasn't sufficient fury to force a vote a no confidence. 
The club's board have survived the motion brought by Agusti Benedito , but they cannot relax yet, as the winter transfer market is their next test and it is just around the corner. 
These are some of the issues which must be resolved once the January market opens. Arda Turan 
Barcelona tried to offload Arda Turan during the summer window, given that Ernesto Valverde doesn't plan to use him much this season. 
There was an opportunity for the Turkish midfielder to return to former club Galatasaray, but he declined that offer in order to see out his contract, which runs until 2020. 
This is a tricky situation which needs to be solved. Yerry Mina 
A deal for Yerry Mina to join Barcelona for nine million euros is in place, however the arrival date remains up in the air. 
The initial idea is for him to stay with current club Palmeiras until next summer and it would only be in the case of injury that his transfer would be brought forward to January. A midfielder 
Marco Verratti was one of Barcelona's main targets for 2017, but he didn't come and they are still looking for a player of his profile. 
Jean Michael Seri was close to joining in the last transfer window, before that option was thrown out, although he may yet be set for a move to the Camp Nou. 
Schalke's Leon Goretzka is another player to have piqued interest at the Camp Nou and, given that his contract expires in June, this is a deal the board could need to start working on soon. A star signing 
Coutinho is still on Barcelona's radar, even if they couldn't prize him away from Liverpool, despite his handing in of a transfer request. 
There is still hope that he could move to Catalonia, even if it's considered "very difficult" for him to arrive in January. 
Furthermore, he would not be able to play for Valverde in the Champions League, having already represented the English side in the competition. Cargando siguiente contenido

posts.text:
Barcelona Had his say on Pique and Umtiti Mascherano considers leaving Barcelona at end of 2017/18 season Facebook Mascherano more of a substitute than ever before 
T he 2018 World Cup will mark the end of Javier Mascherano's international career, but the 33-year-old could be set to leave Barcelona next summer as well. 
With Gerard Pique and Samuel Umtiti forming a solid central defensive partnership, minutes are becoming scarce for the midfielder-turned-centre-back and he will study his options. 
"I still have a contract with the club, but it's clear that maybe once the season finishes I'll I look at what to do," he said in an interview with TyC Sports. 
"But I've not yet spoken with anyone. 
"Barcelona have always shown that they are happy with me. 
"There will be a time to think. 
"It's more than obvious that I play less frequently at my club because I have two other centre-backs there who are better. 
"I try to fight for my place and, above all, to be ready for when I'm called upon." 
He is, though, completely sure that he won't continue to play for Argentina after next summer. 
"My time with the national team will come to an end in Russia and won't go on any further," he said. 
"I'm motivated to try to repeat the performance we had in the 2014 World Cup." 
Finally, the player reflected on Lionel Messi 's performances and insisted that it was important for the No.10 to have made it to another World Cup. Cargando siguiente contenido

thread.title: Hazard: Cristiano Ronaldo deserves the Ballon d'Or because he won everything | MARCA in English

posts.author: John Sibleyreuters
posts.title: Hazard: Cristiano Ronaldo deserves the Ballon d'Or because he won everything | MARCA in English
posts.text:
Pique: Ronaldo is the favourite to win the next Ballon d'Or 
E den Hazard believes he has no chance of claiming the Ballon d'Or award this year and that Cristiano Ronaldo should win it, based on his performances last season. 
The Belgian midfielder stated that the titles won by Ronaldo and his key role in Real Madrid's success should seal the coveted prize for the Portuguese international. 
"I do not have a chance to win [the Ballon d'Or] and I think a lot of players are better than me," he told Sky Sports. 
"But I am happy to be listed in the 30 candidates for the award. 
"I think this year Ronaldo deserves it because he won with Portugal, he won LaLiga and he won the Champions League. 
"If I want to win it in the future then I need to win everything [with my club and Belgium]. 
"I know I am on this list because I play for Chelsea and because I have great teammates and they help me to be on this list. 
"I do not know if I will have the chance to win it in the future, but it is not my goal now. 
"My goal is to play and be happy with my performances on the pitch." 
Hazard also told Sky Sports that he believes that Chelsea are a strong candidate to defend their Premier League title this season. 
"Unlike last season, the two Manchester clubs are very good and they win their games, but I think we are equal with them," he said. 
Chelsea take on Crystal Palace this weekend as they aim to close the gap to those at the top. Cargando siguiente contenido

W ayne Rooney scored a 90th-minute penalty to salvage a 1-1 draw for Everton away at Brighton and Hove Albion in the Premier League on Sunday. 
The hosts had looked on course to take all three points from a drab match when Anthony Knockaert pounced on a loose ball and fired home eight minutes from fulltime. 
Yet Brighton defender Bruno caught Dominic Calvert-Lewin with an elbow in the final minute and Rooney converted the resulting penalty to rescue a point for Ronald Koeman's side, whose difficult start to the season continued. 
The draw moves both teams on to eight points and lifts them one place in the table, Brighton to 14th and Everton to 16th. Related tags

Ronaldinho repeats his jaw-dropping Villarreal overhead kick 
P ep Guardiola's promotion to the Camp Nou dugout in the summer of 2008 coincided with Ronaldinho 's Barcelona exit and the story goes that the Catalan coach didn't want the superstar Brazilian to form part of his squad. 
Yet the former Blaugrana No.10 has contradicted that version of events, insisting that the decision was his own.

thread.title: Zidane: Coaching Barcelona? I have a white heart | MARCA in English
thread.title_full: Zidane: Coaching Barcelona? I have a white heart | MARCA in English

posts.author: Juan Ignacio Garc A-Ochoaadapted Padraig Whelan
posts.title: Zidane: Coaching Barcelona? I have a white heart | MARCA in English
posts.text:
Benzema trains normally and will face Getafe 
A s Zinedine Zidane prepares to set up his side without the crocked Gareth Bale, he admitted he had no answer as to why the Welshman has been so unlucky with injury. 
Following an impressive performance recently in the Champions League against Borussia Dortmund, his progress has been halted after sustaining another knock. 
Zidane insisted that the forward will not be rushed back from injury and isn't too worried yet about the persistent fitness problems the player is suffering from, while also brushing off suggestions that he should have been sold in the summer. 
"He is okay and is doing better every day," he said to reporters at his pre-match press conference. 
"He was very good in Dortmund but felt some pain in his calf and that worsened after he met up with Wales for international duty. 
"I can't say if he will be back in a week or 10 days, we just have to wait and see, but he is determined to return as soon as possible and that's good. 
"Now we have to be calm and exercise patience with him. I don't know why he has been injured so much because I'm neither a doctor nor a physio. 
"I have confidence in the people who work here but I can't do anything about it. Bale is the man who is most disappointed because he wants to be out there playing. 
"I don't think about anything like whether or not he should have been sold, you have to live in the present." 
On Saturday, the Frenchman celebrates his 100th game in the Real dugout and revealed what his happiest moment so far has been as well as pondering what he has learned during his time in charge. 
"I think the biggest thing I've learned is that you must take advantage of things and you must do that by working hard every single day you are here," he added. 
"The most beautiful moment for me so far here has been winning LaLiga. 
"You fight for that every day, it is a tremendously difficult thing to do and winning it is the ultimate feeling." 
Asked if he ever regretted not coaching Barcelona or any other side, Zidane's response was unequivocal. 
"I have a white heart," he said. 
"I'm here now, I only think about what I'm doing now, and playing was the same." 
Atletico Madrid take on Barcelona in the game of the weekend, but the Frenchman isn't interested in the goings on elsewhere. 
"I want to win our game," he explained. 
"I don't want any result in particular, I just want to win." Related tags

posts.title: Gunathilaka's six-match ban reduced by half on appeal | MARCA in English
posts.text:
Cricket Sentenced for misconduct during the series against India Gunathilaka's six-match ban reduced by half on appeal Reuters Sri Lanka suspend Gunathilaka for six matches 
D anushka Gunathilaka's ban from six limited-overs matches for misconduct during the home series against India has been cut by half following an appeal by the Sri Lankan all-rounder, the country's cricket board said on Tuesday. 
The remaining three matches will be part of a suspended sentence over a one-year period, Sri Lanka Cricket said in a statement. 
Gunathilaka was suspended and fined 20 percent of his annual fee this month after a complaint by Sri Lanka team manager Asanka Gurusinha. Local media reported the 26-year-old had missed a training session. 
"The Executive Committee of Sri Lanka Cricket yesterday decided to revise the suspension imposed on Dhanushka Gunathilaka upon consideration of the appeal made on behalf of Gunathilaka by the Sinhalese Sports Club," SLC said. 
Gunathilaka, who has played one test and 28 ODIs, pleaded guilty to the charges and missed Sri Lanka's one-day series against Pakistan. 
Sri Lanka lost all three tests, five one-dayers and the one-off Twenty20 international against India. Related tags

thread.title: Keylor: "No podemos salir satisfechos"
thread.title_full: Keylor: "No podemos salir satisfechos"

posts.author: marca.com
posts.title: Keylor: "No podemos salir satisfechos"
posts.text:
Did Lloris make a great save or was it a Benzema blunder? 
I n what was a generally underwhelming performance from Real Madrid as a team, Keylor Navas was the shining light in Tuesday's 1-1 draw with Tottenham Hotspur, yet the Costa Rican stopper made clear Los Blancos cannot leave the Estadio Santiago Bernabeu satisfied. 
The former Levante keeper faced a difficult evening with Harry Kane in top form, yet he thwarted the English striker on numerous occasions. 
"We can't leave satisfied," he explained. 
"We wanted to win, but thanks to God we were able to do our job well. 
"They had opportunities and we did too, it was a nice match." 
Mauricio Pochettino's side were efficient in defence and kept the hosts to the one goal, an achievement that Navas was quick to praise. 
"Lloris made big saves, we had chances but the things we tried didn't go the way we wanted," he continued. 
Failing to keep a clean sheet is always disappointing for a goalkeeper, yet given the quality of the opposition it was always unlikely, though the 30-year-old didn't wish to dwell on the frustration. 
"We always want to keep a clean sheet, but there are situations we can't control," he admitted. 
"Hopefully in the future we can avoid conceding a goal and manage to record the victory." Cargando siguiente contenido

thread.title: Messi scores his 100th goal in European competition | MARCA in English
thread.title_full: Messi scores his 100th goal in European competition | MARCA in English

posts.author: Lorenzo Laramadridadapted Chris Winterburn
posts.title: Messi scores his 100th goal in European competition | MARCA in English
posts.text:
Champions League Of which, 97 have come in the Champions League Messi scores his 100th goal in European competition Lorenzo Lara 
I n the clash with Olympiacos , Lionel Messi scored his 100th goal in European competition with the Argentine forward needing only 122 matches to reach the milestone. 
His opening match came back in December 2004 against Shakhtar Donetsk under Frank Rijkaard's tutelage. 
Rather ironically, his first European goal then came against Greek opposition in Panathinaikos, goalkeeper Mario Galinovic becoming the first to concede to the imperious forward in the Champions League. 
Several goalkeepers have gone up against Messi with varying degrees of success over his career and the two who have conceded the most to him have been Bernd Leno and Christian Abbiati, with seven. 
In fact, Messi has notched against 37 different teams in Europe and has only failed to score against seven of the sides he has faced. 
In all four Champions League matches the 30-year-old has played against Atletico Madrid, he has failed to score a single goal, despite having netted 27 times against Los Colchoneros in domestic tournaments. 
Arsenal are his favourite rival, over the course of all his meetings with the North London club, the Argentine has scored nine times, the next closest are AC Milan and Celtic with eight each. 
Being predominantly left footed, it should come as little surprise that 82 of Messi's 100 goals have come from his natural side and 14 have been courtesy of his right foot while just four have been headers, including his memorable goal against Manchester United in the 2009 final. 
The Argentine thus becomes the second ever footballer to reach this milestone with Cristiano Ronaldo taking 143 matches to hit 100 European goals. Related tags

thread.title: Valverde on his first 100 days: I would give the team a ten | MARCA in English
thread.title_full: Valverde on his first 100 days: I would give the team a ten | MARCA in English

posts.author: Xavi Hern Ndezbarcelonaadapted Tim Hanlon
posts.title: Valverde on his first 100 days: I would give the team a ten | MARCA in English
posts.text:
Luis Suarez's one remaining blemish 
W ith plenty of doubts surrounding Barcelona ahead of the season, Ernesto Valverde has far exceeded expectations in his first 100 days in charge but the unasuming coach has diverted praise on to his players. 
The Catalan side lead LaLiga and against the odds, considering their resounding victory in the Supercopa de Espana over their arch-rivals, it has been Real Madrid who have stuttered. 
"We are concentrating on our play and in eleven versus eleven, these 100 days certainly haven't been boring and we are hoping for another 100 more calm," said Valverde. 
"It is best too look forward and I would give (the team) a ten (out of ten) but we need now to look at the 265 days ahead." 
Barcelona dropped their first points in LaLiga away to Atletico Madrid last weekend and they will look to get back to winning ways against Malaga on Saturday. 
"This week there are three games in six days and tomorrow we will put out the ideal side to win three more points," Valverde stated. 
"I cannot say if it is just coincidence but if you look at Malaga then they play well against Barca no matter who is the coach. They are a side that makes it difficult for you and they come here needing to pick up points. 
"They lost players over the summer like Fornals and Camacho, and they are a side that when that happens it is normal that you notice it. I realise that they are under a certain amount of strain." 
Valverde has rotated his squad a lot so far but along with Lionel Messi, he has continued to play Luis Suarez in attack even though he has not been at his best. 
In the Champions League against Olympiacos, Deulofeu was replaced instead of Suarez even though the Uruguayan looked sluggish. 
"He has a slight knock but was able to finish the game," explained Valverde. 
"He is a top goal scorer and in a match he will have three or four chances for the team. If not then he will be battling against the defenders and it would worry me more if he wasn't creating chances." Related tags

En Español 
W olfsburg coach Martin Schmidt has found a new formula for his players to perform at their best and improve results. 
The former Mainz boss has revealed that brushing up the players' dental hygiene will help give them an extra edge. 
"At the end of the training, acidity is created inside of the mouth," Schmidt indicated in a recent press conference. 
"This attacks the gums and ends directly in the blood, so brushing the teeth helps to recover energy better and prevent acidity. 
"Therefore, players are required to brush their teeth immediately after the end of their physical effort, even before returning home." Related tags

France Brazilian in the news again Now Neymar has fallen out with Unai Emery Facebook Cavani plays down Neymar feud 
A few weeks ago, Paris Saint-Germain had to deal with the controversy surrounding the fall out between Neymar and Edinson Cavani, and now it seems that the Brazilian is at odds with his coach, Unai Emery. 
After a light training session in the wake of their Champions League game, Neymar wanted to continue, with particular emphasis on specific ball work with some reserve team players. 
It was a request that Emery flatly refused. 
According to L'Equipe, the player angrily kicked a ball against the wall in front of Emery and his teammates before heading into the dressing room area. 
In France, speculation is rife that the rift between resulting from the misunderstanding has completely disrupted PSG's preparations for the game against Marseille. Cargando siguiente contenido

thread.title: Luis Suarez sends message of support to player suffering discrimination in Uruguay | MARCA in English
thread.title_full: Luis Suarez sends message of support to player suffering discrimination in Uruguay | MARCA in English

posts.author: Sergio P Rez
posts.title: Luis Suarez sends message of support to player suffering discrimination in Uruguay | MARCA in English
posts.text:
America Amateur insulted due to his disability Luis Suarez sends message of support to player suffering discrimination in Uruguay Facebook The more chances Luis Suarez misses the better 
I n a classy touch, Barcelona forward Luis Suarez has came to the defence of a Uruguayan amateur footballer who suffered from discriminatory insults during his most recent game. 
The incident took place during a clash in the Second Amateur B division in Uruguay between Platense and Rocha. 
Matias Dutour was representing Rocha and was the victim of disappointing chants and abuse from Platense supporters, who mocked the malformation in his left arm which prevented his limb from developing completely. 
The condition has thankfully not prevented the 22-year-old from fulfilling his dream of becoming a footballer and he has trained with the first team of Nacional, one of Uruguay's biggest clubs, before joining Rocha. 
"Hi Mati! Don't listen to those mediocre people who don't know the effort that you make to fulfil your dream. You are an example of what it is to overcome," Suarez wrote on his Twitter account and included Dutour's profile in the message. 
It was through Dutour's own Twitter account that he first reported the ugly incidents which cast a shadow over the game. 
"Since I came on until I left, all I heard was discriminatory shouts. I'm not made of stone, I just want to play football," he said. 
After the complaint, the player received numerous messages of support from fans of his own club and others across the football world, while his club also confirmed on Twitter that they have reported the incidents. 
The story of Dutour, who as Suarez pointed out is a shining example of overcoming the odds, was included in a FIFA report on their website in both English and Spanish. 
"I don't consider myself a role model to anyone but I assume some responsibility I guess because there may be children or parents in a situation similar to mine and I try to help them," he said. 
"I always want to be myself and do things right. I take it as another challenge in my life and my career but for me, I'm an ordinary person and if that helps someone else, then that's even better." Hola Mati! No hagas caso a los mediocres que no saben el esfuerzo que haces para cumplir tu sueño. Sos EJEMPLO DE SUPERACIÓN @MatiasDutour 
? Luis Suarez (@LuisSuarez9) 23 octobre 2017 No puedo creer como existe gente tan mierda como ese hincha de @ca_platenseuy que en vez de alentar a su equipo se dedico a discriminarme 
? Matias Dutour (@MatiasDutour) 21 octobre 2017 Desde que entre hasta que sali, fueron solo gritos discriminativos! Uno no es una piedra, solo quiero jugar al fútbol

thread.title: Paulinho: From mockery to applause | MARCA in English
thread.title_full: Paulinho: From mockery to applause | MARCA in English

posts.author: Ramiro Aldunatebarcelonaadapted Padraig Whelan
posts.title: Paulinho: From mockery to applause | MARCA in English
posts.text:
Barcelona stay on track 
P laying for Barcelona and having the Camp Nou cheer you on when you take to the field isn't something you get to enjoy every day, and yet that is the feeling that midfielder Paulinho enjoyed during Saturday's victory over Malaga . 
He entered from the bench in order to allow Sergio Busquets some rest and experienced what his friend and international teammate Neymar enjoyed many times as a Blaugrana player: the affection of the Catalan faithful. 
There is no scientific formula to guarantee this kind of favour from the terraces in football. 
In fact, in the case of Paulinho, it is particularly notable as he was a player who arrived at the club during the summer from Guangzhou Evergrande amid much criticism. 
That was down to the price paid for his signature, his age, and the suspicion that Barcelona had forked out for a player whose ability wouldn't suit their style. 
At times, his signing became something bigger than a simple summer arrival and he was almost used as a stick with which to beat Josep Maria Bartomeu for his leadership along with Robert Fernandez. 
Jokes were made and some within the media even published claims that those in the dressing room had commented that the former Tottenham man's ability was below that of even Douglas when he had played for Barcelona. 
Two months later, there aren't many vocal critics left and fans have a special place in their hearts for Paulinho, perhaps an acknowledgement that they were unfair to him at first. 
Ernesto Valverde was one of the biggest supporters of the midfielder's signing and pushed for the club to get him, while always defending Paulinho publicly and endorsing that confidence with paying time. 
When he doesn't start, the midfielder is one of the substitutes who regularly appears from the bench and it is also interesting to note that Paulinho is the team's third top scorer, tied with Denis Suarez and behind only Lionel Messi (15) and Luis Suarez (three). Related tags

posts.title: Real Madrid are number one for bringing through youth talent in top leagues; Ajax top overall with 71 players
posts.text:
Football Ajax produce most among 31 European championships Real Madrid are number one for bringing through youth talent in top leagues EFE Ronaldo beats Messi and Neymar to be voted best player 
W hile Ajax are the club that produces most players from their youth system with 71 who play in the 31 main European leagues, Real Madrid have the most players in the five 'big' leagues, with 41. 
The study, by CIES, takes into account the players who have been at a club for at least three seasons between the ages of 15 and 21, in the 31 major national league championships throughout Europe. 
In all of them, according to this study, the best European academy is Ajax who are followed by Dinamo Zagreb (67 players), Partizan Belgrade (61) and Real Madrid (58). In this classification, Barcelona (50) hold the eleventh spot. 
In relation to the five 'big' leagues (England, Germany, Spain, Italy, France), the European football academy that produces most players is Real Madrid, with 41, Athletic Club (29), Manchester United (28), Inter and Real Sociedad (23), Rennes, AC Milan and Valencia (22). posts.title: Countdown for Bale | MARCA in English
posts.text:
Real Madrid The Welshman, after 28 days out, wants to face Girona Countdown for Bale Bale trains on Valdebebas pitch 
G areth Bale has the Champions League clash with Tottenham Hotspur clearly in his mind and he sees the LaLiga clash with Girona as an opportunity to prove his fitness. 
Ever since the draw was made on August 24th, Bale has been looking forward to the chance to face his former club and he is desperate to recover from the calf injury that has kept him out of action for 28 days so far. 
It was expected that he would be missing for a month and that is about right as he is now able to exercise with a ball on the pitch, with the next step to rejoin his teammates. It is possible that this next step could take place today although it is Friday that has been marked down by the coaching staff. 
If all goes according to plan then Bale could travel to Girona and play some minutes that would give him a platform to build on ahead of the Spurs game. 
Clearly he won't be a starter against Tottenham due to his fitness level and also because Zidane is planning to play a four-four-two system with Isco in midfield. The treatment room is clearing 
With Bale soon to be back, gradually the treatment room with just Carvajal and Kovacic the pair who still don't have a return date pencilled in. Cargando siguiente contenido

thread.title: Kameni: I like being Barcelona's ogre
thread.title_full: Kameni: I like being Barcelona's ogre

posts.title: Kameni: I like being Barcelona's ogre
posts.text:
Kameni haunted MSN 
G etting under the skin of Barcelona is a rare trait in world football but Carlos Kameni has made a knack of it during his career, becoming the bogeyman that he loves to be thanks to a number of star showings versus the Blaugrana. 
Now with Fenerbahce, the Cameroonian shot-stopper can fondly look back on keeping eight clean sheets in 24 encounters with the Catalans as his former team Malaga travel to Camp Nou this Saturday. 
"The truth is that it makes me very happy that people remember me for those games, for having had good performances against Barcelona, for keeping clean sheets, and for being their ogre," he told MARCA. 
"Those games with Barcelona have defined my life. I think most players are remembered for particular moments; the strikers for a great goal, the midfielders for a exceptional pass, or for one overall performance. And I know that the clashes against Barcelona, and many of them at the Camp Nou, have defined my career. 
"In Turkey there are many people from Real Madrid and Barcelona, and many approach me and say 'thank goodness you're not in LaLiga because you always annoyed us'. And this makes me very happy. 
"It is also true that these games have more significance than others and that the saves in these clashes were seen by more people." 
Kameni was asked to reveal his secret to being so stubborn against the Blaugrana, with four of his clean sheets coming for Malaga and another four during local derbies as an Espanyol player. 
"Well, there is no secret," he admitted. "And the merit is on the whole team. 
"I always say that we must all defend. We are a block. Without the help of my colleagues, all of them so not only the defence, these clean sheets could not have been achieved. 
"We stopped Barcelona in those eight games but it is also fair to say that in all those matches we suffered, because Barcelona push you to the limit, both physically and psychologically." 
Reminiscing about Malaga's sterling 0-0 draw at the Camp Nou last campaign, the keeper talked us through a key save from Neymar during the game. 
"Yes, I remember that one well," said Kameni. "I stopped the ball with my right hand while jumping and covering the angle. 
"In fact, it is one of the moments I remember most from the matches against Barcelona. As well as a save for Espanyol in 2004/05 season, when we drew 0-0 away. But I think my most complete game was with Malaga, in the 1-0 win at the Camp Nou [in February 2015]." 
Terrorising the Andalusian team's defence on Saturday will no doubt be Lionel Messi, a player that Kameni has witnessed many times and has deep respect for. 
"There will only be one like him, he's among the most formidable players I've ever faced," said the Cameroonian 
"He's truly world class and can read the game at any time and from any position." Related tags

posts.text:
Ligue 1 According to Le Parisien Paris Saint-Germain teammates unhappy with Neymar privileges Facebook Neymar: I will always have Barcelona in my heart 
S pecial privileges that have been allowed to Neymar on his signing for Paris Saint-Germain have not gone down well with his teammates, according to La Parisien. 
These include having two personal physiotherapists that are dedicated only to him, in training players are not allowed to put strong tackles in on him and he is also exempt from defensive duties during matches. 
Financially, Neymar also has benefits such as for example he is the only player that has his own branded bag and the sponsor that he chooses, while the rest of the players must have bags with the PSG logo on it. 
There will also be further privileges for next season, said Le Parisien, and he will have the right to take all the penalties instead of sharing them like he does at the moment with Cavani. Cargando siguiente contenido

thread.title: Cosmin Lambru - Teenage footballer makes professional debut with a prosthetic arm
thread.title_full: Cosmin Lambru - Teenage footballer makes professional debut with a prosthetic arm

posts.title: Cosmin Lambru - Teenage footballer makes professional debut with a prosthetic arm
posts.text:
Video Cosmin Lambru was in a car accident aged eight Teenage footballer makes professional debut with a prosthetic arm Facebook Indonesian star redefines the term 'pace' with rapid wonder goal 
S eldom does football provide such heartwarming stories, yet that is exactly the case for Cosmin Lambru's professional debut as the 18-year-old made his first senior appearance whilst wearing a prosthetic arm. 
Despite being involved in a serious car accident at age eight, he was hit by a truck and lost his left hand, Lambru has risen through the ranks of Petrolul Ploiesti and was given his first appearance as a substitute in a cup match against Mioveni. 
Unfortunately for the midfielder, Petrolul were eliminated from the tournament on penalties after a 1-1 draw. 
The story of the teenager's survival is miraculous, despite the harrowing injuries he suffered and has had to learn to live with ever since, it is only courtesy of the truck passing over him that he survived. 
"We were coming home when a truck skidded and headed towards me," he explained in an interview with Romanian sports paper Daily Sport. "I threw myself into the vehicle to try and get under it. 
"I felt terrible pain but I was aware that I had been taken to hospital." 
Ever since it has been his dream to be a professional footballer, a decade later he has achieved this dream, a moment that Lambru saw as a reward for his refusal to ever give up. 
"When I first returned to football, I had to learn how to fall on my arm," he intimated.

thread.title: McLaren drivers face hefty penalties in Mexico | MARCA in English
thread.title_full: McLaren drivers face hefty penalties in Mexico | MARCA in English

posts.title: McLaren drivers face hefty penalties in Mexico | MARCA in English
posts.text:
Mexican F1 Grand Prix 2017 Alonso and Vandoorne expect to start from the back row McLaren drivers face hefty penalties in Mexico Reuters Hamilton wants to seal title with a win 
M cLaren drivers Fernando Alonso and Stoffel Vandoorne expect to start Sunday's Mexican Grand Prix from the back row after incurring hefty grid penalties for engine changes. 
"Unfortunately I think we will have to change the engine again," double Formula One world champion Alonso told reporters at the Autodromo Hermanos Rodriguez circuit on Thursday. 
"We will start at the back. Probably this circuit is not the preferred one for our package anyway so we expect not to be super-competitive here. 
"Maybe it is the best place to take the penalty and hopefully invest in Brazil and Abu Dhabi with this new engine," added the Spaniard, who expected a complete swap of power unit components. 
Former champions McLaren are ninth in the championship and 20 points adrift of eighth-placed Haas with three races remaining. 
Their season has been beset by reliability problems with the Honda engines, triggering the decision to switch to Renault power next year. 
"We're taking some engine penalties this weekend, because we know it's a tricky weekend for us," Vandoorne told reporters. "I think for me it will be the full package, so 35 places. 
"To be honest, I know how to deal with these situations now," added the Belgian. Related tags

thread.title: Arda Turan content in his new life as a Barcelona outcast | MARCA in English
thread.title_full: Arda Turan content in his new life as a Barcelona outcast | MARCA in English

posts.title: Arda Turan content in his new life as a Barcelona outcast | MARCA in English
posts.text:
Barcelona No issue with Valverde's lack of trust Arda Turan content in his new life as a Barcelona outcast Facebook Galatasaray close the door 
I f anyone's potential is not being fully met at Barcelona under Ernesto Valverde, it is Arda Turan, and yet the Turkish winger is understood to be happy to wait out his contract at the Camp Nou. 
Offered a chance to leave to China last summer and back to Turkey the summer before that, the midfielder has rejected all openings and is waiting around on the far-flung fringes of the Barcelona squad in the meantime. 
However sources within the dressing room intimate that Turan's attitude has not changed under Valverde; in fact he is still cheerful and smiling when around his teammates. 
That image is far from the usual one of a player tearing at the bit to get away when not playing but it is clear that the Turk is not in usual circumstances and is happy to wait for the perfect opportunity or his contract's expiration date of June 2020. 
Such a relaxed attitude is not present in the Barcelona offices, who are growing apathetic over a talented footballer who is wasting away in a sporting sense, with the chances of a top European club taking a gamble on his signature almost nil while he remains so far outside the coach's plans. Barcelona All missed training on Friday Iniesta, Mascherano and Vermaelen absent for San Mames Xavi Hernández Barcelona already preparing for trip to Bilbao 
B arcelona will be without trio Andres Iniesta, Javier Mascherano and Thomas Vermaelen for Saturday's trip to face Athletic Club . 
None of the three trained with their teammates on Friday for various reasons and will not travel to Bilbao. 
The Blaugrana captain is suffering from discomfort in his left thigh, Mascherano has been unable to shrug off a fever and Vermaelen has a muscle problem in his right leg. 
They are joined on the treatment table by longer term absentees Rafinha and Ousmane Dembele, while Arda Turan and Aleix Vidal missed the midweek Copa del Rey win through physical issues. 
With that amount of injuries, it is expected that Valverde will promote at least one youth team player to Saturday's first team squad. Cargando siguiente contenido

B efore the clash between Getafe and Real Sociedad, a La Real supporter recommended that his side attacked by focusing on centre-back Juan Cala, who ended up having the last laugh on social media. 
After a 2-1 win, Cala remembered and didn't hold back. 
He played the full 90 minutes as Getafe came back from behind to win, with two goals in the last 12 minutes giving the home side the three points. 
"You have to attack on the side of Juan Cala, the worst and slowest central defender in LaLiga," the fan said.

posts.title: Varane vuelve a caer
posts.text:
Real Madrid Replaced by Nacho at half-time Varane hit by injury again David G. Medina Andujar: There was no penalty when the ball hit Benzema's hand, it was involuntary 
Z inedine Zidane was forced to use his first Real Madrid substitution of the game against Girona to withdraw Raphael Varane at half-time as he suffered from muscle discomfort. 
Nacho replaced the Frenchman in the heart of defence, with the extent of the injury not yet known. 
The 24-year-old appeared to suffer the problem in the 43rd minute after a defensive error by Marcelo. 
It is not the first time that Varane has suffered knocks and strains, as season after season they deny him the chance to earn a regular place in the side. 
He has already missed games against Valencia and Levante in the Estadio Santiago Bernabeu. 
Now, on the day that he made his 200th appearance for Real Madrid, he has suffered another injury. 
Having arrived at just 18 years of age in 2011, he didn't celebrate in the way he would have been hoping to against Girona. Cargando siguiente contenido

posts.text:
Champions League Tebas has filed a report, according to L'Equipe LaLiga's plan to exclude PSG from European competitions uncovered Facebook UEFA launch Financial Fair Play investigation into PSG spending 
L aLiga do not want Paris Saint-Germain competing in the Champions League and Javier Tebas is said to have even filed a complaint to UEFA in August with a complete study that shows the Ligue 1 side are financed by the State of Qatar. 
Anger was sparked in the Spanish top-flight's establishment when Neymar was plucked by Les Parisiens for 222 million euros with league chief Tebas adamant that something was amiss. 
French newspaper L'Equipe published a report on Monday outlining the complaints made by LaLiga against PSG. 
"We have seen that PSG and Manchester City have invested more than any other club in the last five years," Tebas is quoted as saying. 
"Their real income cannot justify these investments so they have fictitious sponsors, related to the State, with amounts that are bigger than those of Real Madrid, Barcelona, Bayern Munich or Manchester United. 
"The revenues are directly or indirectly related to the Qatari state and PSG are continuing to cheat economically." 
In the 44-page report, LaLiga have reportedly pointed out that PSG have invested far more than any other club in recent years - 344 million euros in 2014, compared to Manchester United's 237m euros, Real Madrid's 224m euros and Barcelona's 185m euros. 
Regarding television rights, PSG earn far less than Real Madrid - 47m euros compared to 121m euros. 
LaLiga came to the conclusion that Qatar's sponsorship of the side is 73 percent more significant than that of United, Real and Barcelona. 
Tebas' report has already initiated an investigation, and LaLiga intend to initiate further action against the club, as well as possibly taking the case to the European Union. 
"We will wait until the end of the year to see what UEFA does," Tebas said. "If nothing happens, we will complain to the EU because this should not continue. 
"If we discover that they are guilty, they should not compete in the Champions League." Cargando siguiente contenido

posts.title: El Madrid vestirá de negro en su estreno en Wembley
posts.text:
Tottenham vs Real Madrid Match is a sell out Real Madrid to wear black kit on Wembley debut Santiago Siguero Wemble 
O n their first match at Wembley stadium, Real Madrid will play in their second, black kit against Tottenham Hotspur. 
Tickets for the Champions League game have all sold out and 3,200 Los Blancos fans from Spain and several parts of Europe are expected to take their seats. 
Meanwhile, more than 300 journalists are set to cover this season's second game between the two teams, both of whom will hope to capture first place in group H. 
Mauricio Pochettino's team, who managed to escape from the Estadio Santiago Bernabeu with a solid 1-1 draw, will wear their normal home kit for Wednesday's encounter. Cargando siguiente contenido
